member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Zip.CompressionType
member.summary: Represents the compression types.

member.name: F:Telerik.Windows.Zip.CompressionType.Default
member.summary: This is the default compression type which uses the deflate algorithm.

member.summary: This compression type uses the LZMA algorithm.

member.summary: Represents a class that provides LZMA decompression.

member.summary: Represents a class that provides LZMA compression.

member.summary: Specifies default property.

member.summary: Specifies size of dictionary.

member.summary: Specifies size of memory for PPM*.

member.summary: Specifies order for PPM methods.

member.summary: Specifies Block Size.

member.summary: Specifies number of postion state bits for LZMA

member.summary: Specifies number of literal context bits for LZMA

member.summary: Specifies number of literal position bits for LZMA

member.summary: Specifies number of fast bytes for LZ*.

member.summary: Specifies match finder. LZMA: "BT2", "BT4" or "BT4B".

member.summary: Specifies the number of match finder cyckes.

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream
member.summary: Represents a stream that can read from a compressed stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ZipInputStream class.
member.param: The stream that will be decompressed.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ZipInputStream class.
member.param: The stream that will be decompressed.
Identifies whether the ZipInputStream should stop reading after the end of the deflated part of the base stream is reached.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seeking is not supported.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writing is not supported.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the current stream and releases any resources associated with the current stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.BaseStream
member.summary: The stream that is decompressed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.
member.returns: true if the stream supports reading; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.
member.returns: true if the stream supports seeking; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.
member.returns: true if the stream supports writing; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.CompressedSize
member.summary: Gets the compressed size of the stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the length in bytes of the stream.
member.returns: A long value representing the length of the stream in bytes.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the position within the current stream. Set is not supported.
member.returns: The current position within the stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.UncompressedSize
member.summary: Gets the uncompressed size of the stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.DeflatedBlockSize
member.summary: Gets the size of the deflated block if it is deflated with the Stored method.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.IsBaseStreamStored
member.summary: Identifies if the base stream is deflated with the Stored method.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipInputStream.ShouldReadAfterDeflatedBlock
member.summary: Identifies whether the ZipInputStream should stop reading after the end of the deflated part of the base stream is reached (default value is true).

member.name: T:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream
member.summary: Represents a stream that can write into a compressed stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ZipOutputStream class.
member.param: The stream that will be compressed.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Cancel
member.summary: Stops the compression of the stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the current stream and releases any resources (such as sockets and file handles) associated with the current stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the ZipOutputStream. If the value is set to false it just finishes the writing, otherwise closes the stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reading is not supported.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Seeking is not supported.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Setting length is not supported.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.BaseStream
member.summary: The stream that is compressed.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.CanRead
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.
member.returns: true if the stream supports reading; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.CanSeek
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.
member.returns: true if the stream supports seeking; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.CanWrite
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.
member.returns: true if the stream supports writing; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Checksum
member.summary: Gets the checksum of the compressed stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.CompressedSize
member.summary: Gets the compressed size of the stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Length
member.summary: Gets the length in bytes of the stream.
member.returns: A long value representing the length of the stream in bytes.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.Position
member.summary: Gets the position within the current stream. Set is not supported.
member.returns: The current position within the stream.

member.name: P:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipOutputStream.UncompressedSize
member.summary: Gets the uncompressed size of the stream.

member.summary: This method is used to open a ZipPakcage from a stream.

member.summary: Checks whether the stream that represents a zip file is actually a zip file.

member.summary: Checks whether the file with the passed file name is actually a zip file.

member.summary: Adds a file with the passed file name in the ZipPackage.

member.summary: Adds a file with the passed file name in the ZipPackage.

member.summary: Adds the files from the passed array of file names in the ZipPackage.

member.summary: Adds the files from the passed IEnumerable of file names in the ZipPackage.

member.summary: Adds the files from the passed IEnumerable of file names in the ZipPackage.

member.summary: Adds a stream in the ZipPackage and associates it with the passed file name in zip.

member.summary: Adds a stream in the ZipPackage and associates it with the passed file name in zip.

member.summary: Adds a file with the passed file name in the ZipPackage and associates it with the passed file name in zip.

member.summary: Adds a file with the passed file name in the ZipPackage and associates it with the passed file name in zip.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipPackage.Add(System.String,System.String,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Adds a file with the passed file name in the ZipPackage, associates it with the passed file name in zip and sets a date time for the entry.

member.summary: Adds a file with the passed file name in the ZipPackage, associates it with the passed file name in zip and sets a date time for the entry.

member.summary: Adds a stream in the ZipPackage, compresses it with the passed compress method, associates it with the passed file name in zip and sets a date time for the entry.

member.summary: Adds a stream in the ZipPackage, compresses it with the passed compress method, associates it with the passed file name in zip and sets a date time for the entry.

member.summary: Adds a stream in the ZipPackage, compresses it with the passed compress method, associates it with the passed file name in zip and sets a date time for the entry.

member.name: M:Telerik.Windows.Zip.ZipPackage.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the ZipPackage. If the value is set to false it just resets the internal values, otherwise closes the file.
